item.title: Sweep of Blair-Caldwell Housless Encampment Thursday (Tomorrow...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep of Blair-Caldwell Housless Encampment Thursday (Tomorrow 10/29)

The same site where an SOS camp was approved then denied by the Mayor just weeks ago.

...
People without housing have been living around Blair-Caldwell Library for many months. There has been close collaboration between residents of the encampment and library staff. Until the last few weeks, the number of encampment residents was kept around 15 or 20 so as to fit in the best space available next to the library. But after recent sweeps of multiple encampments from nearby areas, this Blair-caldwell encampment naturally grew as others had nowhere to go. Now there are at least 50 people living here...and they are being told to scatter scram.

This is also the same site that was recently proposed for a Safe Outdoor Site that the Mayor originally approved and then pulled his support last minute after a Business Improvement District spoke against it. A vision of what it could look like to have this very site be a living space for around 40 people has already been shown and approved by City departments like fire, water, and DDPHE, and yet, just because the Mayor cares more about business interests than people’s lives, this is not happening and all these people living here will be scattered to no where.

Residents of this encampment include many elderly disabled people, young people who work full time jobs, people who can’t go to shelters due to previous abuse by other guests, people who have lived on the streets for years sitting on housing wait lists, and more.

This sweep is scheduled for this week - in spite of the cold and snow.

This insanity and inhumanity must end.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at Blair-Caldwell Library as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive - while being forced to nowhere by the City.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Sweeps of 22nd and Wazze and 6th and Sherman POSTPONED: Sweep...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps of 22nd and Wazze and 6th and Sherman POSTPONED: Sweep still planned at Blair Caldwell on Thursday

So there has been lots of back and forth over the past couple days about whether the sweeps at 22nd and Wazze and 6th and Sherman will be on this week due to the weather. After being told 22nd was off than on for today, then off again, it is confirmed there should be no sweep at either of these sites today. A huge relief for residents and supporters!

Again we note that i...f an encampment is to be swept (which none should be in the first place) after a posted sweep date has been missed, the City should re-post another 7 day notice per the lawsuit agreement.

There is also still a sweep planned this week planned for Thursday at Blair-Caldwell Library. Many of these residents have loved there for many months...others have been swept there recently.

For Thursday come and support with the following items...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More

item.title: Sweep of 22nd and Wazze Residents POSTPONED Due to Weather, BUT...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep of 22nd and Wazze Residents POSTPONED Due to Weather, BUT rescheduled for this WEDNESDAY with no posted notice: Sweep still planned at other sites for Wednesday and Thursday this week

So the City has recognized that sweeping people and taking their gear in 14dregree weather is not a good idea this week, but they have no problem still sweeping in 30 degree weather the day after with no posted notice.

The sweep scheduled for Tuesday at 22nd and Wazze has been postponed ...one day, until Wednesday (10/28).

This is the same day as another sweep is planned at 6th and Sherman. How they will sweep two locations at once we do not know...

There is also a third sweep this week planned for Thursday at Blair-Caldwell Library.

For Wednesday and Thursday come and support with the following items...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More

item.title: Sweep of 22nd and Wazze Residents POSTPONED Due to Weather:...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Sweep of 22nd and Wazze Residents POSTPONED Due to Weather: Sweep still planned at other sites for Wednesday and Thursday this week

The City has recognized that sweeping people and taking their gear in 14dregree weather is not a good idea this week - so the sweep scheduled for Tuesday at 22nd and Wazze has been postponed. We still do not know when it has been postponed until, but it should be re-posted for another 7 days in order to follow the lawsuit agreements.

There are s...till two other sweeps planned for this week: Wednesday at 6th and Sherman, and Thursday at Blair-Caldwell Library.

For Wednesday and Thursday come and support with the following items...
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: So instead of sweeps, there was a study where some homeless ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

So instead of sweeps, there was a study where some homeless folks were just given a lump sum of cash 7500 $. Data shows they spent it better than the city does to get themselves housed.

At 50K$ a sweep you could just give the money away and house people who, once stable, can take care of themselves.

So with money wasted on dozens and dozens of sweeps, that would be hundreds and hundreds of people housed. More people housed would mean fewer camps and we would actually make ...some progress to reduce homelessness.

A link to the actual study in the comments.. Tell the Mayor about data like this that leads to results.

https://www.thedenverchannel.com/…/50-people-battling-homel…

See MoreIn September, Foundations for Social Change, a Canada-based charity, wrapped up two years of research where they gave 50 people battling homelessness a lump sum of $5,700. The group found they used the money to help secure food and housing, rather than spend it on illicit substances.

thedenverchannel.com

50 people battling homelessness were given $5,700. What they did with it might surprise you

In September, Foundations for Social Change, a Canada-based charity, wrapped up two years of research where they gave 50 people battling homelessness a lump sum of $5,700. The group found they used the money to help secure food and housing, rather than spend it on illicit substances.In September, Foundations for Social Change, a Canada-based charity, wrapped up two years of research where they gave 50 people battling homelessness a lump sum of $5,700. The group found they used the money to help secure food and housing, rather than spend it on illicit substances.

item.title: Blair-Caldwell Library Housless Encampment to be Swept Thursday...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Blair-Caldwell Library Housless Encampment to be Swept Thursday (10/29)

The same site where an SOS camp was approved then denied by the Mayor just weeks ago.

...
People without housing have been living around Blair-Caldwell Library for many months. There has been close collaboration between residents of the encampment and library staff. Until the last few weeks, the number of encampment residents was kept around 15 or 20 so as to fit in the best space available next to the library. But after recent sweeps of multiple encampments from nearby areas, this Blair-caldwell encampment naturally grew as others had nowhere to go. Now there are at least 50 people living here...and they are being told to scatter scram.

This is also the same site that was recently proposed for a Safe Outdoor Site that the Mayor originally approved and then pulled his support last minute after a Business Improvement District spoke against it. A vision of what it could look like to have this very site be a living space for around 40 people has already been shown and approved by City departments like fire, water, and DDPHE, and yet, just because the Mayor cares more about business interests than people’s lives, this is not happening and all these people living here will be scattered to no where.

Residents of this encampment include many elderly disabled people, young people who work full time jobs, people who can’t go to shelters due to previous abuse by other guests, people who have lived on the streets for years sitting on housing wait lists, and more.

This is the third sweep scheduled for this week - in spite of the cold and snow.

This insanity and inhumanity must end.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at Blair-Caldwell Library as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive - while being forced to nowhere by the City.

item.title: Think about it, a neighbor going round the block purposely...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Think about it, a neighbor going round the block purposely laying on their horn to be annoying. In other instances we have seen police flash lights and lay on horns at all hours of the night to disrupt camps.

Colorado Village Collaborative

It’s 25 degrees outside and lightly snowing. In spite of our efforts to establish Safe Outdoor Space outside of Blair Caldwell Library being thwarted, the numbe...rs of campers here continue to grow.

Instead of delivering a dignified, person centric, harm reduction approach to these neighbors they are left outside without the services and resources they need.

Meanwhile, a housed member of the community drives around the block over and over again laying on his horn to agitate our unhoused neighbors.

We need Safe Outdoor Spaces now. w/ Interfaith Alliance of Colorado w/ St. Francis Center

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud
